items.title: Privacy Policy
items.summary: Privacy Policy For the purposes of this document, “we” refers to Reading Kids Connect. At Reading Kids Connect, we are committed above all to the safety and privacy of all participants. What personal information does Reading Kids Connect collect? How do we use personal information?…
items.content_html:
Privacy Policy

For the purposes of this document, “we” refers to Reading Kids Connect.

At Reading Kids Connect, we are committed above all to the safety and privacy of all participants. 

What personal information does Reading Kids Connect collect?

  • Personal information is only collected directly from online application forms.
  • Personal information about children under 13 is collected from parents. Personal information is collected from minors over 13 after obtaining parental consent. 
  • We collect the following information from participants over 13 or parents of participants under 13: 
    • Contact information (name, age, email address, phone number)
    • Parent/guardian name, email address, and phone number (if under 18)
    • Matching information (including Internet access, skills, hobbies/interests, age preference, availability) 
  • We collect the minimum information necessary to match and contact participants.

 

How do we use personal information?

  • We use personal information only to match and contact participants, so that all parties can have the best possible experience.

 

Who is personal information shared with?

  • Mentees’ information (first name, age, parent/guardian name, email address, phone number, and a general introduction) will be shared with the mentor. Mentors’ information (full name, email address, phone number, and a general introduction) will be shared with the family of the mentee. 
  • If we suspect illegal behavior or threats to the health and safety of any individuals, we reserve the right to share any user’s information with the appropriate legal authorities so that the situation can be investigated and prevented. 

 

Is personal information collected during video sessions with mentors?

  • Video sessions are never recorded. No photographs or audio/video recordings will be taken of participants.
  • Reading Kids Connect is not responsible for any information that a mentee or their family chooses to share with their mentor after they are matched. Likewise, we are not responsible for any information that a mentor chooses to share with their mentee or mentee’s family after they are matched. However, mentors must sign an agreement that they will not disclose any information about mentees or their families that they may learn from video sessions except in the cases described above.

 

When will I be contacted by Reading Kids Connect?

  • ‍We will contact parents or mentees over 13 only for the following reasons:
    • Pairing you with a mentor
    • Notifying you of any changes in our policies
    • Providing you with additional information about this program
    • Responding to any questions or concerns you may have
  • We will contact mentors only for the following reasons:
    • Scheduling your initial interview and volunteer trainings
    • Matching you with a mentee
    • Following up on video sessions 
    • Notifying you of any changes in our policies
    • Responding to any questions or concerns you may have 
  • If you no longer want us to contact you or you no longer wish to participate, please email readingkidsconnect@gmail.com.
  • We do not use your personal contact information to send you any unsolicited information, and we do not provide it to third parties.

 

Who maintains personal information at Reading Kids Connect? Who can I contact to update or remove my or my child’s personal information?

  • A participant or their parent or guardian can update their or their child’s information or end participation in the program at any time. 
  • Participants’ information will be maintained in password-protected files.
  • Personal information is maintained by authorized staff of Reading Kids Connect. For all inquiries about personal information or about this privacy policy, please email readingkidsconnect@gmail.com.

items.title: Testimonials
items.summary: Testimonials My son really enjoys learning and playing games with his mentor. Alexa has gone above and beyond anything I expected. We are so grateful for her. She is an amazing role model and I would consider her part of our family now, she is…
items.content_html:
Testimonials

My son really enjoys learning and playing games with his mentor.

Alexa has gone above and beyond anything I expected. We are so grateful for her. She is an amazing role model and I would consider her part of our family now, she is an awesome “big sis!” ...We want to support Alexa the way she has been there for us and often included my oldest child as well, which is above and beyond!

The girls both play games with their mentors. They have interesting conversations and chat about things going on in the world.

items.title: How It Works
items.summary: How It Works: Finding a Mentor How It Works: Becoming a MentorYou fill out a Google form. We'll get some basic information about you, your interests, and your experience.You have a short, virtual interview where we ask you a few questions about your experience and…
items.content_html:
How It Works: Finding a Mentor

  1. You fill out a Google form with your child (they can fill it out themselves if they are over 13!). We'll get some basic information about you, your child, and what you are looking for.
  2. We pair your child with a mentor based on their availability, preferences, and interests. You'll receive an email connecting you with a mentor!
  3. You, your child, and your mentor have a Family Meeting virtually or in person. Together you decide on a meeting schedule and figure out your goals.
  4. Your child meets regularly with their mentor and forms a bond with them!

How It Works: Becoming a Mentor

  1. You fill out a Google form. We'll get some basic information about you, your interests, and your experience.
  2. You have a short, virtual interview where we ask you a few questions about your experience and interests and tell you more about the program.
  3. We pair you with a mentee based on your availability, preferences, and interests. You'll receive an email connecting you with a mentee!
  4. You, your mentee, and your mentee's parent or guardian have a Family Meeting virtually or in person. Together you decide on a meeting schedule and figure out your goals. 
  5. You meet regularly with your mentee and form a bond with them!
  6. You attend virtual weekly Mentor Meet-Ups to meet and learn from other mentors and receive support.

items.title: Team
items.summary: Team Madeline Liberman founded Reading Kids Connect in May of 2020. As Director, she is responsible for intake and support of mentors and mentees, administration, and development. Madeline is also a mentor with the virtual mentorship program Hearts Over Hands. In high school, she was…
items.content_html:
Team

Madeline Liberman

Founder and Director

Madeline Liberman founded Reading Kids Connect in May of 2020. As Director, she is responsible for intake and support of mentors and mentees, administration, and development. Madeline is also a mentor with the virtual mentorship program Hearts Over Hands. In high school, she was a co-leader of the BOLD club, a leadership and empowerment club for middle school girls in Reading. A 2019 graduate from Reading Memorial High School, Madeline is pursuing a B.A. in Urban Studies from Barnard College.

AUTUMN HENDRICKSON

Assistant Director

Autumn Hendrickson joined the team in early June and has been working with Madeline Liberman ever since. As an assistant director, Autumn does a little bit of a lot of things, from helping to take notes during meetings, to writing emails and occasionally posting for social media, and contributing to the Reading Kids Connect newsletter. She will be attending Endicott College majoring in English Secondary Education.

items.title: Mission
items.summary: Mission A mentor is someone who allows you to see the hope inside yourself. - Oprah Winfrey Mission Statement We are a group of Reading residents participating in a mentorship program to better ourselves and our community. Originally, we started this to provide a way…
items.content_html:
Mission

A mentor is someone who allows you to see the hope inside yourself.

- Oprah Winfrey

Mission Statement

We are a group of Reading residents participating in a mentorship program to better ourselves and our community. Originally, we started this to provide a way to ease the pain of social isolation created by quarantining during the early months of the COVID-19 pandemic but we are adapting and changing to ensure that this mentorship program is available to all those who need and want it.

Our Objectives

  • Build strong and positive connections between older students and younger students.
  • Give young adults a way to take on additional responsibilities while bettering their community.
  • Create a safe place for learning, whether it's academic learning or emotional and mental growth.
